heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The closest lightning strike recorded happened on 13 May 2025 and was just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 15 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 5th since records began in 23 September 2024.  The current stretch started on 09 September 2025 and has lasted 9 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%) and rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 557 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1044 m), feels like temperature (up 3.0°C), and outside temperature (up 2.3°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 557.0m lower than yesterday, 532.6m lower than the past week, 1044.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 850m to a maximum of 2900m, averaging 989.7m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1522.2m and 2030m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, pleasant humidity levels and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and the light is absent. Similar weather conditions should remain.
